title: Specific Sans Recommendation
content:
Hello,

I am looking for a nice, chunky (with bold, black or ultra weights), sans serif typeface designed by a woman. No offense, men.

Thanks.

 [‹ Jane Magazine type ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35172 "Go to previous forum topic") [Interesting typographic places in Berlin? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34882 "Go to next forum topic")
author: armin

comments.content: There doesn’t appear to be very many choices. I remember a thread about the lack of women in type design. Someone mentioned that in his class women outnumber men (an inspiring statistic), so maybe if you wait there will be more options.

- [PTL Skopex Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.primetype.com/faces_info.php?fid=37) by Andrea Tinnes  
(5 weights & italics and small caps each — ‘contemporary, vertical’)
- [FF Karbid](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_karbid/) by Verena Gerlach  
(3 weights & Display cuts, small caps etc. — ‘Berlinesque, readable’)
- [Linotype Authentic Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.linotype.com/970/linotypeauthenticsans-family.html) by Karin Huschka  
(4 weights & italics each — ‘post-modern’)
- [Ambigue](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.linotype.com/56036/ambigue-family.html) by Carla Schweyer  
(7 weights — ‘low x-height’)
- [Ronnia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/type-together.com/font_ronnia_home.php) by Veronika Burian  
(5 weights & italics each — ‘humanist’)

I’ll leave it to you to judge whether they’re <cite>chunky</cite> or not …

Florian, great recommendations. Thanks! Ronnia looks like a great option.

Jupiterboy, I’m actually looking for a sans companion to [Sybille’s Odille](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.vllg.com/Kontour/Odile/mudTyper+Weights/), so it’s funny that you brought up cholla.
Perhaps the designer has a beta sans version?

Armin, you’re welcome. It was very informative for me to take a look at foundries’ libraries from that special angle.  
I’ve got one more; double female power:

- [Shannon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120064307/http:/www.linotype.com/158631/shannon-family.html) by Janice Prescott Fishman & Kris Holmes  
(4 weights, 1 italic — ‘Irish, legible’)
